digest_items.title: Use security headers scanner
digest_items.why: Missing security headers leave applications vulnerable to common attacks
digest_items.fix: Use securityheaders.com to scan and implement recommended headers

digest_items.title: Enable database encryption at rest
digest_items.why: Unencrypted databases are vulnerable if storage media is compromised
digest_items.fix: Enable Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) or equivalent for your database

digest_items.title: Use principle of least privilege
digest_items.why: Excessive permissions increase blast radius of compromised accounts
digest_items.fix: Grant only minimum necessary permissions for each role

digest_items.title: Implement disaster recovery plan
digest_items.why: Disasters and ransomware require tested recovery procedures
digest_items.fix: Document RTO/RPO, maintain offline backups, and test recovery quarterly

digest_items.title: Implement DMARC policy
digest_items.why: DMARC builds on SPF and DKIM to give domain owners control over email authentication

digest_items.title: Implement rate limiting on APIs
digest_items.why: Rate limits prevent brute force attacks and API abuse
digest_items.fix: Use middleware like express-rate-limit or nginx limit_req module

digest_items.title: Use TLS 1.3 exclusively
digest_items.why: Older TLS versions have known vulnerabilities and weaker cipher suites
digest_items.fix: Update server config to disable TLS 1.0, 1.1, 1.2 and enable only TLS 1.3
